channel.title: Space Station News
channel.description: A RSS news feed containing the latest NASA press releases on the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA Assigns Chris Cassidy to Next Space Station Crew, Holds Media Briefing
item.description: NASA astronaut Chris Cassidy will return to the International Space Station next April.

item.title: NASA TV to Air Departure of Japanese Cargo Spacecraft from Space Station
item.description: NASA will broadcast the departure of a Japanese cargo spacecraft from the International Space Station beginning at 1 p.m. EDT Friday, Nov. 1, on NASA Television and the agency’s website.

item.title: NASA Television Coverage Set for Cygnus Resupply Mission to International Space Station
item.description: NASA commercial cargo provider Northrop Grumman is scheduled to launch its next resupply mission to the International Space Station at 9:59 a.m. EDT Saturday, Nov. 2. NASA’s prelaunch coverage will air live on NASA Television and the agency’s website beginning Friday, Nov. 1.

item.title: Maine Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
item.description: Students from Maine will have an opportunity next week to talk live with a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA Invites Media to Boeing Orbital Flight Test Launch for Commercial Crew
item.description: Media accreditation is open for Boeing’s uncrewed Orbital Flight Test (OFT) to the International Space Station, as part of NASA’s Commercial Crew Program.

item.title: NASA Invites Media to Next SpaceX Space Station Cargo Launch
item.description: Media accreditation is open for the launch of the next SpaceX delivery of science investigations, supplies, and equipment to the International Space Station.

item.title: Maryland, Washington Students to Speak with NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
item.description: Students from Maryland and Washington, D.C., will have an opportunity this week to talk with a NASA astronaut currently living and working aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: In-Space News Conference to Review First All-Woman Spacewalk
item.description: NASA astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir will participate in a news conference from orbit at noon EDT, Monday, Oct. 21, following their Friday spacewalk – the first to be conducted by two women.

item.title: NASA to Televise First All-Female Spacewalk, Host Media Teleconference
item.description: On the first ever all-female spacewalk, NASA astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir will venture outside the International Space Station about 7:50 a.m. EDT Friday, Oct. 18, to replace faulty equipment on the station’s exterior. Live coverage will begin at 6:30 a.m. on NASA Television and the agency’s website.

item.title: NASA Announces Changes to Spacewalk Schedule, First All-Female Spacewalk
item.description: NASA is hosting a media teleconference at 4:30 p.m. EDT today to discuss this week’s first all-female spacewalk at the International Space Station. Audio of the teleconference will stream live on the agency’s website.
